ygData.subject: Re: kos
ygData.msgSnippet: The only place that I know raises faction with the dwarfs and involves a bit less risk is to kill everything in the beholder maze. I am not sure how much it
ygData.messageBody:
The only place that I know raises faction with the
dwarfs and involves a bit less risk is to kill
everything in the beholder maze. I am not sure how
much it takes, because i am still KOS to dwarfs..but
the human necro I was with is now able to travel those
lands without trouble. Also, beholder critters raise
faction in Rivervale..I was able to raise it enough to
walk in the city and even sell. Also, i am not sure
but the goblins in Runnyeye may also help factions..

Xraxex D'Tosorv
Indigo Brotherhood
Karana Server

--- Joboo <joboo@...> wrote:
> From: Joboo <joboo@...>
>
> finda enchanter to help ye in ye troubles
>
> Zamtik
>
> On 29 Jun 1999 slu@... wrote:
>
> > Mallachyte
> >
> > I really don't know if the guy will ace you or not
> when you initiate a trade...I would con him & be
> ready to beat feet if it doesn't work. If you can
> give him belts & shoulderpads it certainly will help
> your faction. Perhaps your mage friends (if you've
> got them) might be willing to root the fellow or use
> some other creative magical solution to save your
> bacon (I have no idea how high a level he is
> either). This solution is a pure brainstorm on my
> part.
> >
> > Oh well I suppose this will be all trial and error
> and in many ways that is what makes the game fun.
> Imagine how happy you'll be if it works.
> >
> > Robert
> >
> >
> > > ** Original Subject: Re: [warriors_eq] kos
> > > ** Original Sender: Mallachyte@...
> > > ** Original Date: Tue, 29 Jun 1999 16:05:01 EDT
> >
> > > ** Original Message follows...
> >
> > >
> > > From: Mallachyte@...
> > >
> > > Do you becove visable when you give the dwarf
> the belts? I would love to get
> > > my Dark Elf in there and do that. Right now,
> all guards from the boat to the
> > > front gates of Kaladim regard me warmly, and
> after that, it's KOS all the way
> > > to the zone to Greater Faydark. Is there
> another thing that needs killing to
> > > make the dwarves around there like me? I lost
> over 1 bubble and level 14
> > > because I thought that the dwarves liked me,
> then one just killed me. No
> > > chance to run far enough away, so I had to go
> back to Faydwer from the South
> > > Gate of Freeport. Got there, tried to use
> /corpse, but it was too far away,
> > > got closer and the dwarf killed me again. Back
> in Freeport. Took the boat
> > > again, got the first body back. Got an invis,
> used /corpse command over and
> > > over to drag it. Accidentally right clicked
> corpse. Became visable, killed
> > > again. One more time on the boat, and I finally
> got my stuff back. So, if
> > > there is any way that I can give the dwarf the
> belts without being by it, I
> > > would really, really appreciate the info.
> > >
